alert.note: Alert for West Glacier Region (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 23 at 1:23PM MST until December 24 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST SATURDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Snow. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 5 inches. For the winter storm watch, heavy snow transitioning to heavy mixed precipitation. Total snow accumulations 2 to 7 inches and total ice accumulations of up to two tenths of an inch possible. * WHERE...Bad Rock Canyon, Essex, Highway 83 Bigfork to Swan Lake, Marias Pass, and Polebridge. * WHEN...Until 5 AM MST Saturday. For the winter storm watch, from Saturday morning through Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions and low visibility. Side roads could become treacherous Saturday night through Sunday morning due to freezing rain on packed snow.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
